ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to apply what I learned in Chem lecture to a real life situation involving chemistry.
Hands-on skills regarding chemistry experiments and procedures; methods for writing lab reports and analyzing data/error
Basic Chem lab skills how to rinse stuff with deionized water and titration and such
General lab procedures that will prepare me for future courses within the same field.
Lab skills
Learned beginning lab skills, set up, cleaning supplies, doing experiments, etc.
scientific writing and experimental design
Knowledge of basic chemistry lab experiments and techniques.
How to write a lab report. How to make a graph in excel using data. How to write equations on word and format a lot. Also, further developed my understanding of Chem 161
I developed the efficiency and skill at which I perform experiments in a laboratory setting.
i learnt a lot about the skills needed to be employed in the chem lab and how to write a scientific lab report
The course was well organized and i learned a lot of new procedures used in a lab
If you want to learn the skill set of writing in a way only applicable to the chemistry academia, this is the class for you
I learned basic chemistry laboratory techniques and etiquette, as well as how to write a lab report. I performed many experiments that added to my knowledge obtained from General Chemistry I lecture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that this course was done really well.

Strengths: very organized and straightforward, allows for greater understanding of material learned in CHEM 161; many resources for help
Weaknesses: at times, there was not a great turnaround for grades, which made it difficult to gauge how well you were doing or how to improve in future assignments
Dr. Lant did a really great job at making this course engaging and useful despite the somewhat boring content
Very engaging and overall helpful, so not a lot of room for improvement.
I thought it was very well run

The course is very good as long as you stay on top of it. It's manageable with a helpful pre-lab video and quiz to make sure you know the experiment you're conducting, plus it matches well with the content of Chem 164 to help understand concepts.

Strengths: Dr. Lant!! Is ! A ! GEM!! Please don't go to UChicago :( Her and Chris were also AMAZING at giving feedback and making themselves available for office hours, etc.! 
Weaknesses: workload is really high for a half-credit course, and lab reports took me ages. The length of lab reports could be cut down a bit, given the level of specificity required, but this really isn't a big deal.

Strengths for me was the professor (Dr. Lant) and teaching fellow (Kristian Oleson). They were so helpful all of the time and such great people to be around in the lab that made this first lab at Yale fun and engaging. I thought another strength was the occasional class periods of getting help with writing a lab report. These made writing the lab reports a lot easier/more smooth. Not really any weakness for the class, except I wish I could have gotten to know the people in the class before choosing a lab partner rather than just sort of randomly being assigned.

the lab reports were really time consuming, the course workload is definitely worth more than 0.5 credits. i spent many hours doing the reports as much 1 credit courses.

strength: very rigorous and meticulous, enjoyed lab time as well as lab workshop hours and the pre lab lectures
Strength is definitely the instructors who were super helpful and very accommodating. Weakness is the super long lab reports which sometimes just seem like a stats class
The stoichiometry rules were not really taught, but other than that it went about as well as a hen chem lab can go

A big strength of the course was the lab report workshops that were occasionally held to help with the upcoming lab reports. It was incredibly helpful to have a session where I could ask for help on my lab report simultaneously while doing it.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This course is necessary for a lot of people, but I think that it teaches a lot about chemistry and applications of it later on

If you are taking this course, it's probably for a prereq but it is honestly very helpful for a greater foundational understanding of CHEM 161 material, as many of the labs correspond to topics discussed in class. Also helps with learning how to write and analyze scientific reports
you probably have to take it
Yes, if they are going to be taking more science and lab courses in the future because it is a good intro course.
Yes. Even if they are slightly interested in chemistry, its a great way to be hands on and to be able to see the concepts learned in class in play
I would, very fun class as long as you're good about lab reports getting done on time.
Standard lab course with superb instructors, so yes!

Yes, if you are a chem major/pre-med or any major that requires it. If you are just interested in taking a lab, I think you should choose the topic you are most interested in and a professor that is good and nice. I got really lucky that I had two great helpers who made lab fun and easy.
yes, if you want to get insight into how to engage in chemistry lab in a structured and rigorous way, this course is great
Yes, if you are looking to be any science major this course teaches you the fundamentals of writing lab reports
Its only worth half a credit, so no. Only if a major requirement
